prompt:
Prompt:
Some people think students should study the science of food and how to prepare it. Others think that school time should be used in learning important subjects. Discuss both views and give your opinion?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
When I was kid, I didn't known how to prepare food and that lead me to have diabet. Nowadays, some person think it is important to learn how cooked food and how it is composed. Other argue, that it is not as important as other subject. I think that to teach the science of food can help to save money and to avoid disease. On the other hand, it is important teach them climate change and other topic like biochemistery which are essential.
First of all, it is important to teach in our school how are composed food and how to cook them without spend a lot of money. On reason of that, is because we had spam of advertising around us and, if we did'nt have the good information, we could be more guillible and buy fast food. This misinformation could lead to waste money and poor choice for our health. For example, if you don't know where find carbohydrate, fiber and protein, you will choose the bad food and listen marketing.
In fact, nutrition is not the only subjet which is important, that our time is limited. Moreover, with global warming, our world could encounter a huge challenge during the next century. For instance, climate change and global warming are more important for their education rather than science of nutrition, because they need to be prepared to these big change.
In my point of view, it is important to teach nutrition to our children, because that could lead at an improvement of their health and lifestyle. In contrast, it is not the only issue in the world and they needed to know the fundamental knowledge about the world like chemistery, biology, physic to understand more advanced topics. For example, how can they understand why would needed protein if they didn't understand biochemistery.
To conclude, although, it is a good idea to teach nutrition to our children cause ofthat can help in their life to save money, have a healthy life it is as more as important to give them more primarly knowledge and information more important about the world.
",
evaluation:
"Criteria for evaluation:
1. Task Response: The essay addresses both views and gives the writer's opinion.
2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay has a clear structure with introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. Ideas are presented logically.
3. Lexical Resource: There is a range of vocabulary used, but there are some errors and incorrect word choices.
4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy: There are several grammatical errors throughout the essay.

Overall, based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 5 for this essay. While the essay addresses the prompt and has a clear structure, there are several errors in vocabulary and grammar that affect the clarity of the writing. Additionally, the essay could benefit from more developed and well-supported arguments."}]

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people think students should study the science of food and how to prepare it. Others think that school time should be used in learning important subjects. Discuss both views and give your opinion?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
I think students should study about food in schools more frequently. Some people think there is not so much to learn about food, but I think that is wrong. There are lots of different way of preparing food, and it takes lots of time to master them. Also, science behind food is very complex, but it is significant in our life. I will demonstrate my opinion in detail in this essay.
First of all, food is a critical part of a life. In many culture, having and preparing food is considered one of the most important activities to live a enjoyable life. By having a delicious food, one can feel happiness uncomparable to anything. Moreover, preparing food for someone like family or lover is a tremendously rewarding activity. By preparing food for them, you can show how much you care about them, and share your emotions with them. To enjoy this amazing part of life, it is very important to learn how to prepare food and what makes delicious food.
Secondly, It is crucial to know about how the food effect their health. Some people say 'A human body is a sum of what they have eaten in their life', because The food they ate become a part of their body in the end. We get most of nutritions we need from food. Thus, how we eat massively affect our health. It is scientifically proven that the food culture of a country significantly effect the health status of the people. Therfore, knowing about how the nutritions in food affect our body is very important to leave a healthy life.
For this reason, it is crucial to teach about food to students in schools. Food can be a means of communication sometimes, and it can be a precious present that is given to a life. Moreover, food is a source of energy that sustain us, and sometimes it is a medicine that cure our body. Hence, students should study about how to prepare a good food, and understand how it can affect us by its nutritions.
",
evaluation:
"Overall, this essay addresses the prompt by discussing both views and presenting a clear opinion. However, there are several areas for improvement.

Task Achievement:
The essay adequately discusses both views - that students should study the science of food and how to prepare it, and that school time should be used in learning important subjects. The writer clearly expresses their opinion and provides reasons to support it. Therefore, the essay demonstrates a satisfactory level of task achievement.

Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay lacks proper organization and coherence. The ideas are presented in a somewhat disorganized manner, without clear topic sentences or transitions between paragraphs. This makes it difficult to follow the writer's train of thought. Additionally, the essay is quite short and could benefit from further development and expansion of ideas.

Lexical Resource:
The writer demonstrates a fair range of vocabulary, although there are some errors and repetitive use of certain words. The essay would benefit from a wider variety of vocabulary to enhance the overall quality of the writing.

Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
There are several grammatical errors throughout the essay, including mistakes in subject-verb agreement, verb tense consistency, and word order. These errors hinder the clarity and overall effectiveness of the writing.

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 5 for this essay. While the essay demonstrates a satisfactory level of task achievement and presents a clear opinion, there are significant areas for improvement in terms of coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, and grammatical accuracy.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people think students should study the science of food and how to prepare it. Others think that school time should be used in learning important subjects. Discuss both views and give your opinion?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Some people believe that the science of food and how to make meals should be introduced in schools while others argue that schools should offer only important subjects. I believe that the science of food and how to prepare it should be part of the school subjects as it can bring several benefits in studentï¿½\x80\x99s lives. Thus, this essay discusses how creating an understanding of good nutrition, health and well-being itï¿½\x80\x99s important for students to support positive learning and development.
Modern society with the advertisement of fast food and new products rich in sugar is addressing children and teenagers to choose junk food over healthy. Thus, it is important for schools to introduce the science of food into their curriculum. This subject can positively influence the studentsï¿½\x80\x99 choices about nutrition creating knowledge about food categories, compositions and nutritional values. For example, promoting a healthy and balanced diet can support the students to establish the mindset of acknowledging what they are introducing in their bodies and consequently finding specific foods that might positively impact their well-being.
Contrarily, thereï¿½\x80\x99s the belief that such a subject will reduce the time available for more didactical learning like math, geography or literacy. It might be true as not everyone could be interested in learning about food. However, if observing in detail the science of food, it is evident that it involves a series of challenging topics such as chemistry, biology, food engineering and microbiology.
To sum up, while some people think that introducing the science of food could be detrimental to studentsï¿½\x80\x99 learning as it would reduce the time available for more didactical subjects, on the other hand, learning about food and its composition, can be beneficial as it provides with the knowledge that can support healthy eating and wellbeing.
',
evaluation:
"This essay addresses the prompt and presents both sides of the argument. The writer clearly states their opinion that the science of food should be included in school subjects, and provides reasons to support this viewpoint. 

In terms of Task Achievement, the essay effectively discusses both views and provides reasons and examples to support the writer's opinion. The essay stays on topic and presents a clear argument.

In terms of Coherence and Cohesion, the essay is well-organized with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. The writer uses appropriate transition words and phrases to connect ideas and paragraphs.

In terms of Lexical Resource, the writer demonstrates a good range of vocabulary and uses appropriate terminology related to the topic. There are no noticeable errors in word choice or spelling.

In terms of Grammatical Range and Accuracy, the writer demonstrates a good control of grammar and sentence structures. There are minor errors, but they do not impede understanding.

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 7.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people think students should study the science of food and how to prepare it. Others think that school time should be used in learning important subjects. Discuss both views and give your opinion?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
A group of people believes that students should learn food science at school whereas other groups perceive the idea of gaining knowledge on necessary subjects. Both types of learning have advantages as well as drawbacks and this essay will highlight both sides of the situation.
The knowledge of food science is admired at some educational institutions where learners are expected to master this art. Students can gain numerous benefits by acquiring knowledge of food at the school level. For example, they become capable of making a career in the food industry or conducting further research on the science of food at the tertiary level. Therefore, some people prioritize gaining expertise in food science from schools.
However, some scholars support the concept of learning only essential subjects for academic and professional purposes. Firstly, it is wiser to learn academic courses that provide enormous career opportunities for the future. For instance, learning subjects such as science, business studies, and sports can open the door to chances for a student. Secondly, the majority of the prestigious jobs in the world are related to technology, economics, and communication. As a result, studying these courses at schools prepares a learner to gain expertise and thrive in the professional sector.
In my opinion, students studying at schools should use their valuable time for learning essential subjects as it helps them succeed in the future. Courses such as food science can be learned at a later stage of life. For example, adult learners are able to join an academic course on food science as many institutions provide face-to-face and online courses in this regard. However, knowledge of subjects such as science, business studies, and arts is inevitable to achieve success in the future. Hence, the potential time of school students should be utilized to learn necessary subjects for a better outcome.
',
evaluation:
'Overall, this essay demonstrates a good understanding of the prompt and provides a clear argument with relevant examples. However, there are some areas for improvement.

1. Task Achievement: The essay addresses the prompt by discussing both views and offering a personal opinion. The writer provides reasons for their opinion and includes relevant examples. The arguments are well-developed and support the main points. However, the essay could have provided a more balanced discussion by addressing potential benefits of studying food science at school.

2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay is generally well-organized with clear paragraphs and logical progression of ideas. The writer uses appropriate transition words and phrases to connect ideas and maintain coherence. However, there could be more varied and precise vocabulary used to enhance the flow of the essay.

3. Lexical Resource: The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary with the use of words such as "acquiring," "admirable," "essential," "thrive," etc. However, there is some repetition of words and phrases, which could be improved. Additionally, the essay could benefit from more advanced vocabulary to elevate the language level.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy: The essay shows a good command of grammar with mostly accurate use of tenses, sentence structures, and punctuation. There are a few minor errors, such as missing articles and incorrect word forms, but they do not impede understanding. To achieve a higher band score, there could be more complex sentence structures and a wider range of grammatical structures used.

Band Score suggestion: Based on the criteria above, this essay would likely score around a Band 6.5 to 7 on the IELTS Writing test. The essay demonstrates a good understanding of the prompt, presents a clear argument with relevant examples, and shows a good range of vocabulary and grammar. However, there is room for improvement in terms of balance in the discussion, lexical resource, and grammatical complexity.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people think students should study the science of food and how to prepare it. Others think that school time should be used in learning important subjects. Discuss both views and give your opinion?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
These days, most students learn many school subjects, not only academic topics like math or language but also non-academic, such as science food and how to prepare it. However, not least have their opinion that students should spend more time on important subjects, particularly academic matters. I believe academic and non-academic subjects should be balanced, and this essay will explain both views.
Human brain development makes our kids learn many things in the early phase. Therefore, most elementary students have already learned math or non-native languages, which differs from the past 10 or 20 years ago. Also, they learn subjects unrelated to academics, for instance, science food and how to prepare it. These things are important to them, as they have the knowledge to choose healthy food and prepare it properly, cooked or uncooked. Another reason students should learn about this is that they currently love junk food the most for their daily meals, which is not a good fact for the next generation to have a long life.
Nevertheless, the knowledge of academic subjects should be learned in line with non-academic ones. The main reason is that it will be their foundation for a successful business or career. Without this knowledge, although they have an adequate understanding of the non-academic matter, they will find it hard to compete with other business competitors or candidates in any job recruitment. Eventually, with a long life and a good business or career, they will have a wealthy life ahead and, indeed, their life positively impacts others.
To conclude, students with a balanced knowledge of academic and non-academic subjects will have a bright future with a healthy and wealthy life.
',
evaluation:
'Task Achievement: The essay addresses the prompt by discussing both views and providing a clear opinion. The arguments are supported with reasons and examples. However, the essay could have provided more balanced and detailed arguments for both perspectives.

Coherence and Cohesion: The essay is well-organized with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. Ideas are presented logically and there is a clear progression of arguments. Additionally, the use of transition words and phrases helps to connect ideas and improve coherence.

Lexical Resource: The vocabulary used in the essay is adequate and there is a range of vocabulary related to the topic. Some phrases and collocations are used effectively to express ideas. However, there is limited use of more advanced vocabulary and some repetitive language.

Grammatical Range and Accuracy: The essay demonstrates a good range of grammatical structures, including complex sentences. There are some minor errors in grammar, such as subject-verb agreement and article usage, but they do not impede understanding.

Overall, based on the evaluation of the four criteria, the essay would likely receive a band score of 6.5 or 7. The essay effectively addresses the prompt, presents arguments with supporting reasons and examples, and demonstrates good coherence and grammatical range. However, there is room for improvement in terms of providing more balanced arguments and using a wider range of vocabulary.

',

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people think students should study the science of food and how to prepare it. Others think that school time should be used in learning important subjects. Discuss both views and give your opinion?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
With diet and nutrition becoming more and more popular nowadays, the food industry started to attract a significant number of people to join in, students included. While young people today are encouraged by many to pursue knowledge in related fields, some argue that school time should be invested in other important subjects. Personally, I strongly disagree with the latter.
The insignificance of food study is a misconception because of two major reasons. First of all, food is one of our most fundamental needs, but that doesn't make it less important than other fields. In fact, contrary to the common belief, it is actually a subject that still requires much research. For example, we are yet aware of the exact effects of different nutrtients and chemicals on our physiological process. Another problem is the belief that food is not as promising as other science subjects such as biology and physics. However, the statistics said otherwise. In the past decades, profits generated from food industry have been climbing steadily and already overtaken some of the traditional forms.
Pursuing a degree in food science is never a waste of time but its value has become more prominent in recent years. Not only can it help individuals learn more about the mechanism behind food, but it also enables them to lead a heathier life. In addition, as public awareness in health increases, people are paying more attention to what they put in their mouth, so much so that they are willing to pay for a professional to formulate their meal plan, which is a career with great potential for students interested in food research.
In conclusion, students should be encouraged to study the science and procedures of preparing food because it is a topic just as important as any other subjects.
",
evaluation:
'Criterion 1: Task Achievement
The essay addresses both views mentioned in the prompt and provides a clear opinion. The writer discusses the significance of studying the science of food and how it can benefit individuals in leading a healthier life. The essay also highlights the potential career opportunities in the food industry. However, the essay could have further expanded on the argument for the importance of studying other important subjects. Overall, the essay partially meets the requirements of the task.

Criterion 2: Coherence and Cohesion
The essay has a clear structure with an introduction, body paragraphs discussing each view, and a conclusion. The ideas are logically presented, and there is a progression of thought throughout the essay. The writer uses appropriate linking words and phrases to connect ideas. However, there could be more varied sentence structures and stronger transitions between paragraphs. Overall, the essay demonstrates good coherence and cohesion.

Criterion 3: Lexical Resource
The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary relating to the topic of food and science. The writer uses some academic vocabulary, such as "fundamental needs," "physiological process," and "formulate their meal plan." However, there is room for improvement in terms of the variety and precision of vocabulary used. Additionally, there are a few instances of repetition of words. Overall, the essay shows an adequate lexical resource.

Criterion 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
The essay displays a good range of grammatical structures, including complex sentences and conditional sentences. There are only a few minor errors in grammar, such as subject-verb agreement and incorrect verb forms. The writer generally demonstrates a good control of grammar. Overall, the essay showcases a satisfactory grammatical range and accuracy.

Band Score: Based on the evaluation of the four criteria, the essay can be assigned a band score of 6.5. The essay demonstrates a sufficient level of competence in addressing the task, organizing ideas coherently, using a range of vocabulary, and showcasing a good control of grammar. However, improvements can be made in terms of expanding on the argument for studying other important subjects and using more varied vocabulary.

prompt:
Prompt:
Computers are now the basis of the modern world. They should therefore be introduced into classrooms, and their programs used for direct teaching purposes. However, dependence on computers in teaching may carry a certain degree of risk to students.Discuss both sides and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
In this digital era, people always use the computer to assist their life, including education programs in school. It is so essential that most schools provide computers in the classrooms for their students. However, if the student is too dependent on computers, it will have two impacts, either drawbacks or benefits. In this essay, I will explain my opinion about both sides with relevant examples and experiences.
If we go back twenty years, only a few schools already have computers in their classrooms to support their education programs. Nevertheless, as technology never stops improving, thus the computer itself is getting cheaper every day. Hence, most schools can afford to provide computers in their classrooms now, and there will always be risks involved with that. In this case, a student who relies so much on computers may need more social skills, as the interaction between student and teacher will be less, that caused by the materials and exercises will be delivered online or by any application programs.
Despite the risks, there are also several benefits that students can gain from computers. First, it will provide much positive information or knowledge, not only related to Information Technology but also to other matters. For example, schools can provide an e-learning program for any subject, containing materials to be learned and exercises to be done anywhere and anytime. Besides that, a computer will assist the teacher when reviewing the student's homework.
In conclusion, the benefits of computer dependency in classrooms sometimes outweigh the drawbacks. Eventually, students can study more anywhere and anytime, although there will be a risk related to social concern.
",
evaluation:
'Overall, this essay presents a clear discussion on the topic and provides some relevant examples and experiences to support the points made. However, there are some areas that can be improved for a higher band score.

1. Task Achievement:
The essay addresses the given prompt and provides a balanced discussion on both the benefits and risks of introducing computers into classrooms. The writer also gives their opinion and provides reasons for it. Therefore, the essay achieves the task required.

2. Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay has a clear structure with an introduction, body paragraphs discussing the benefits and risks, and a conclusion. Each paragraph focuses on one main idea and is logically connected to the previous and next paragraphs. However, there could be better use of linking words and phrases to enhance the coherence within and between paragraphs.

3. Lexical Resource:
The vocabulary used in the essay is generally appropriate and accurate. The writer demonstrates a range of vocabulary related to the topic, including terms such as "digital era," "interaction," "e-learning," and "dependency." However, there is some repetition in the use of the word "computers," which could be avoided by using synonyms or rephrasing.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
The essay demonstrates a good command of grammar overall. There are only a few minor errors, such as missing articles or incorrect verb forms. The sentence structures are varied and mostly accurate, although there could be more complex sentences or clauses to showcase a wider range of grammar.

Based on these criteria, the essay would likely be scored at a Band 6 or 6.5 in the IELTS Writing test.

prompt:
Prompt:
Computers are now the basis of the modern world. They should therefore be introduced into classrooms, and their programs used for direct teaching purposes. However, dependence on computers in teaching may carry a certain degree of risk to students.Discuss both sides and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
In this digital era, we canï¿½\x80\x99t deny that the computer is one of the most critical things in the education program. It is so essential that almost every student has already had it in their home or even on their hand. However, I believe that everything in this world has two impacts, either drawbacks or benefits. In this essay, I will explain my opinion about both sides with relevant examples and experiences.
If we go back to 20 years ago, only a few schools already had computers in their classrooms to support their education programs. Nevertheless, as technology never stops improving, thus the computer itself is getting cheaper every day. Hence, most schools can afford to provide computers in their classrooms now, and there always be risks to that. In this case, students may use computers for personal reasons unrelated to the lesson. For instance, they can play a game on the internet or access any prohibited website in the classroom.
Despite the risks, there are also several benefits that students will have from computers. First, it will give them a lot of positive information or knowledge, not only related to Information Technology but also to other matters. For example, schools can provide an e-learning program for any subject, containing materials to be learned in the classrooms and homework to be done by students. Furthermore, it will help not only students but also teachers when reviewing the studentsï¿½\x80\x99 homework with computers.
After all, the benefits of computers in classrooms sometimes outweigh the drawbacks. However, schools must consider the mitigation of any unrelated use of computers if they want to provide computers in their classrooms.
',
evaluation:
"Overall, this essay covers the main points of the prompt and provides relevant examples and experiences to support the writer's opinion. However, there are some areas for improvement in terms of language use and organization. 

1. Task Achievement: The essay addresses both sides of the issue, discussing the risks and benefits of introducing computers into classrooms. The writer gives reasons and examples to support their opinion. The essay fulfills the requirements of the prompt.

2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay is generally well-organized, with clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. However, there could be better use of transition words and phrases to create smoother connections between ideas. 

3. Lexical Resource: The writer uses a range of vocabulary and phrases related to the topic. However, there are some errors and inaccuracies in word choice and sentence structure. Some sentences could be more concise and clear.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy: There are some errors in grammar, such as subject-verb agreement and incorrect verb forms. Some sentences are also awkwardly structured. However, the writer demonstrates a reasonable range of grammar structures.

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 6.5 for this essay. The writer shows good understanding of the prompt and presents a well-organized argument with relevant examples. However, there are some language errors and awkward sentences that affect the overall clarity and effectiveness of the writing.

prompt:
Prompt:
Computers are now the basis of the modern world. They should therefore be introduced into classrooms, and their programs used for direct teaching purposes. However, dependence on computers in teaching may carry a certain degree of risk to students.Discuss both sides and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
As the technology is improving, more people are seeing to become reliable to the computers
What things will they be used for in the future? Is this dependence on computers a good thing or should we he more auspicious of their benefits?
Computers are a relatively new invention. The first computers were built fifty years ago and it is only in the last thirty or so years that their influence has affected our everyday life. Personal computers were introduced as recently as the early eighties. In this short time they have made a tremendous impact on our lives. We are now so dependent on computers that it is hard to imagine what things would be like today without them. You have only got to go into a bank when their main computer is broken to appreciate the chaos that would occur if computers were suddenly removed world-wide.
In the future computers will be used to create bigger and even more sophisticated computers. The prospects for this are quite alarming. They will be so complex that no individual could hope to understand how they work. They will bring a lot of benefits but they will also increase the potential for unimaginable chaos. They will, for example, be able to fly planes and they will be able to co ordinate the movements of several planes in the vicinity of an airport. Providing all the computers are working correctly nothing can go wrong. If one small program fails disaster.
There is a certain inevitability that technology will progress and become increasingly complex. We should, however, ensure that we are still in a position where we are able to control technology. It will be all too easy to suddenly discover that technology is controlling us. By then it might be too late I believe that it is very important to be suspicious of the benefits that computers will bring and to make sure that we never become totally dependent on a completely technological world. As a result, the computers do give people all kind of convience including quickly knowledge and repeatable education. However, the dependence to the computers is really harmmful to both of students and teachers..
',
evaluation:

prompt:
Prompt:
Computers are now the basis of the modern world. They should therefore be introduced into classrooms, and their programs used for direct teaching purposes. However, dependence on computers in teaching may carry a certain degree of risk to students.Discuss both sides and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Computers are presntly an integral part of the civilized world and are essential to daily living. Some individuals believe that they should be introduced into the classroom and used for teaching purposes while others are of the opinion that dependence on computers in teaching may pose a risk to students.
Introducing computers and their programs in educational instuitions for learning purposes is a beneficial thing to students. The world is fast changing and students need to meet up and be at par with others in the world. The globe is becoming a more digital place and computers are the core of that, teaching using computers will open students' minds to new possibilitiies, faster approaches and more advanced ways of solving problems. A recent study showed that 75% of students who were taught using computers are currently more successful than others in their work places.
It is understandable that people also think that dependence on computers in teaching may be detrimental to students. The students may become lazy and may not necessarily want to use their brains to calculate or understand things because the computer has already done that for them. Also using computers to learn in the school environment is also just adding to screen time for the learners; they are already being exposed to lots of wrong things at home adding school to it may not neceesarily the best option.
Personally, students have a lot to learn using computers but truthfully speaking most of them already have the technological know how when it comes to using computers and if they actually want to learn more about how to use them, they can do so at home using the popular learning sites, it doesnt necessarily have to be introduced into the school learning system.
In conclusion,computers are currently the foundation of the modern world and have their advantages and disadvantages, if they are put to the right use at the appropriate place and time, its benefits are beyond measure.
",
evaluation:
"Criteria:

1. Task Achievement:
The essay addresses the prompt by discussing both sides of the argument and giving the writer's opinion. The main points are well-developed and supported with examples. However, the essay could have provided a more balanced evaluation of the risks and benefits.

2. Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay has a clear structure with an introduction, body paragraphs, and a conclusion. The ideas are logically organized and linked together using appropriate transition words and phrases. However, there are some errors in sentence structure and word choice that affect the flow of the essay.

3. Lexical Resource:
The writer uses a range of vocabulary, although there are some inaccuracies and repetitions. Some words are also used inappropriately, which affects the clarity of the essay. Additionally, there are a few errors in word form and collocation.

4. Grammar:
The essay demonstrates a good control of grammar overall, with accurate use of tenses and sentence structures. However, there are some errors in subject-verb agreement, articles, and prepositions. These errors occasionally affect the clarity of the essay.

Band Score: 
Based on the evaluation of the four criteria, I would suggest a band score of 6.5 for this writing essay. The essay demonstrates a good understanding of the prompt and presents a clear argument, but there are some areas that could be improved in terms of coherence, vocabulary, and grammar.

prompt:
Prompt:
The dangers of smoking are well known, yet many people continue with this habit.What are the causes of this? How can we reduce smoking in society?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Many people know the negative consequences of smoking. However, hey still continue this behavior. The main reason is that a cigarette has a chemical component which keeps people smoking and a vital solution to reduce smoking in public is to increase the cigarette price.
With regard to this issue, Nicotine is one of the chemicals that manufacturers use to produce a cigarette and its effect causes smokers to be addicted to the compound. As a result, even though these people understand the degree of this dangerous product, they are not likely to stop using it. Furthermore, many health organizations have announced research demonstrating that the factor that hugely affects smokers to not be able to resist smoking us not a cigarette, but Nicotine.
In order to counteract the situation, perhaps the most effective mitigation is for governments to set the minimum price of a cigarette on markets which is unaffordable for buyers. Consequently, this action possibly decreases the purchasing power of smokers and, subsequently, they tend to discontinue smoking. This is exemplified by the pilot project of Thai government which charge cigarette purchasers ten times higher than the market price in specific areas. After that the authorities conduct public surveys and find that more than 80% of people who used to smoke in the areas quit smoking.
In conclusion, people who smoke cannot change this habit due to Nicotine in a cigarette which can be addressed by governmental policy to raise the price of a cigarette with the view to promote citizens to cease smoking and take care of their health instead.
',
evaluation:
'Criteria 1: Task Achievement

The essay addresses both parts of the prompt, discussing the causes of why people continue to smoke and suggesting a solution to reduce smoking in society. The writer provides reasons for their answer and includes an example from their own knowledge. However, the explanation of the causes of smoking could be further developed and supported with more examples.

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion

The essay is generally well-organized and coherent. The writer uses clear topic sentences and transitions to connect ideas. However, there are some instances of repetitive language and the essay could benefit from a wider range of vocabulary and sentence structures.

Criteria 3: Lexical Resource

The writer demonstrates a sufficient range of vocabulary, but there is room for improvement. Some phrases and word choices are repetitive, and there is limited use of more advanced vocabulary. Additionally, the writer could have used more specific and precise language to support their ideas.

Criteria 4: Grammar Range and Accuracy

The essay shows a good control of grammar and sentence structures. There are only a few minor errors throughout the essay, such as incorrect verb forms and missing articles. However, the writer could have used more complex sentence structures to enhance the essay.

Band Score: 6.5

prompt:
Prompt:
The dangers of smoking are well known, yet many people continue with this habit.What are the causes of this? How can we reduce smoking in society?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Although the health related issues caused by smoking are well known to society, smoking is still a popular habit amongst people. This essay will discuss the causes of the popularity of smoking and what can we do to reduce the number of smokers.
One of the main causes of people starting to smoke is the bad influence of others surrounding them. Most people start smoking at a young age, inspired by their peers or by people older than them already addicted to cigarettes. For example, research shows that nearly all questioned smokers started at a young age and, as they admit it, they started smoking so they can fit-in the surrounding social group. Furthermore, they say that they started smoking because they believed it looked ï¿½\x80\x9ccoolï¿½\x80\x9d and manly because their elders, like fathers, also did smoke.
Even though, in the end, everybody is responsible for the bad choices they make, but it is apparent that something has to be done to reduce the hold that smoking has over society. Awareness campaigns and an increase in the cigarettes cost are the two most efficient ways to prevent people from starting smoking. For example, for the past decade in my country, cigarette advertisements on television or in magazines have been replaced with smoking awareness advertisements showing the horrible diseases caused by this habit. Additionally, every year rise in the cost of cigarettes can be observed. As a result, according to research done recently, the overall number of smokers in our country has been reduced by 50%.
In conclusion, it can be said that most people start smoking at a young age when they are most vulnerable to develop bad habbits and that is why social awareness campaigns have to be done to prevent the young generation from getting addicted to cigarettes.
',
evaluation:
'Criteria for evaluation:

1. Task response: The essay addresses the given prompt and discusses both the causes of the popularity of smoking and ways to reduce smoking in society. The writer provides reasons and examples to support their points. However, the essay could have provided a more comprehensive analysis of the causes and solutions.

2. Coherence and cohesion: The essay is well-structured with clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. The writer uses appropriate linking words and phrases to connect ideas. However, there is room for improvement in terms of providing more logical development of ideas within each paragraph.

Overall, I would suggest a band score of 6.5 for this essay. The essay effectively addresses the prompt, presents relevant arguments, and provides supporting examples. However, there is room for improvement in terms of the depth of analysis, vocabulary usage, and grammatical accuracy.

prompt:
Prompt:
The dangers of smoking are well known, yet many people continue with this habit.What are the causes of this? How can we reduce smoking in society?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
It is very easy to find someone who smokes in today's society. Even though we were taught that smoke is harmful, we see people exhaling this thick fog everyday partly because some people think that it is cool and it can be purchased almost at every store. This essay will discuss deeply about what causes people to smoke and how this issue can be alleviated.
Firstly, part of the society believes that it is trendy to smoke. In many pop culture, such as songs, movies, and novels portray smoking possitively. A comedy show that I have seen illustrates one of the character that smokes to be more cool, giving this character an untouchable aura, whilst other characters that did not smoke seem tangible and therefore mundane. Furthermore, cigarettes are easily accessable in any store. A recent study proved that over 80% of those eager to smoke for the first time actually started this behavior because they can buy it from their local shops. The trend from pop culture and the convenience in accessing smoke adds up to the reasons why some people continues with this habit.
I believe that there are solutions that can tackle and reduce smoking, beginning with medias should portray smoking to have consequences that are relatable. A movie I have seen showed the protagonist's constant need for cigarette throughout the show. However, in the end when he finally unites with his crush, he develops a severe disease, mainly from his smoking habits, in which he regretted in the end. This method of portraying people who smoke totally made my younger niece scared of smoking. In addition, government should control the accessibility of cigarettes. Policies that result and fewer stores being able to sell cigarettes and increasing tax pricing of smoke of any kind will definitely make smoking less convenient for many people.
In conclusion, although many people knew how harmful smoking is, many people think it is cool to smoke and it is convenient and easy to buy. By making smoking less trendy in society and harder to access, I believe that smoking will be less attractive, hence reducing the number of smokers in society.
",

prompt:
Prompt:
The dangers of smoking are well known, yet many people continue with this habit.What are the causes of this? How can we reduce smoking in society?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Nowadays, smoking has become very common in many individuals. Although governments have been trying to prevent people from smoking by displaying many warning advertisements on medias, people struggle to stop smoking. There many reasons that explain this, like the addiction of tabasco, the social effect of smoking, and the lack of awareness about the effects from people. However, many ways to reduce smoking on society exist like the promotion of physical activity as well as medical treaments.
Evidence strongly shows that the habit of smoking is triggered by the addictive side of tabasco. In fact, studies demonstrate that tabasco contain substances that affect areas in the brain which are reponsible of the feeling of pleasure and addiction. Thus, smoking becomes more and more pleasant and addictive. Moreover, smoking is a way of socialization for people. In fact, many individuals enjoy being gathered and discuss while they smoke a cigaret. They find it very relaxing and pleasant, so they do not plan to stop it as it allows them to meet new people for example. Nevertheless, I believe that the lack of awareness from people about the negative effects is a major component that explains why people do not want to stop smoking. Indeed, many surveys show that people do not know that smoking has several negative effetcs. They know about lungs cancer, despite it seems not to afraid them, but tooth and throat issues are less known in the vast majority of smokers.
However, many ways exist in order to encourage people to stop smoking. In my opinion, physical activity and medical treatments are the most effective. In fact, governments have been investing a lot in the promotion of physical activity by the means of advertising campaigns. For instance, in the USA, surveys show that there is an increase of 20% of people doing physical activity in order to overcome their addiction issues related to smoking. Moreover, medical treatments have been improved over the last years so as to help people to cope with their addiction with smoking, and studies show that treatments are becoming more and more effective. For instance, in France, the number of smokers has decreased, and medical treatment is the second reason to explain this phenomenon, behind physical activity.
To conclude, even though there are many reasons that explain the addictive behaviours of people to keep smoking, I believe that there are several ways to improve this situation, particularly by the means of physical activity and medical treatments.
',
evaluation:
'The essay demonstrates a good understanding of the prompt and provides relevant reasons and examples to support the ideas. However, there are some areas for improvement.

1. Task Achievement:
The essay addresses the prompt by discussing the causes of continued smoking and suggesting ways to reduce smoking in society. The writer provides reasons such as the addiction to tobacco, the social aspect of smoking, and the lack of awareness about the negative effects. The solutions suggested are the promotion of physical activity and medical treatments. Overall, the essay achieves the task set by the prompt.

2. Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay is generally well-organized with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and a conclusion. However, there are some issues with cohesion. For example, the transitions between ideas and paragraphs could be smoother. Additionally, some sentences are repetitive, and there is a lack of variety in sentence structures. Improving these aspects would enhance the overall coherence and cohesion of the essay.

3. Lexical Resource:
The writer demonstrates a good range of vocabulary and uses some academic words appropriately. However, there are some errors in word choice and collocation. For example, "tabasco" should be "tobacco," and "promotion of physical activity" could be better expressed as "encouragement of physical exercise." Expanding the range of vocabulary and using collocations accurately would improve the lexical resource.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
The essay shows generally good grammatical control, with a variety of sentence structures used. However, there are some errors in subject-verb agreement, verb tenses, and article usage. For example, "there many reasons" should be "there are many reasons," "tabasco contain substances" should be "tobacco contains substances," and "the addictive behaviours" should be "the addictive behavior." Improving grammatical accuracy would enhance the overall quality of the writing.

Band Score: Based on the overall performance, the essay could be awarded a band score of 6.

prompt:
Prompt:
The dangers of smoking are well known, yet many people continue with this habit.What are the causes of this? How can we reduce smoking in society?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Many people smoke although they know how harmful smoking is. This essay believes that smokers continue to smoke because they are addicted to nicotine they smoke from cigarettes, and government should launch a campaign saying that smoking can make smokers become nasty or unpleasant to help reduce smoking in society.
Many smokers cannot stop smoking because they are addicted to nicotine in the cigarettes they have smoked. Nicotine makes smokers feel relaxed and calm when they smoke and makes them addicted to smoke when they feel they need to relax themselves. For example, many people smoke when they feel stressed and when they smoke they feel more relaxed and get some new work ideas according to many smoking survey reports.
It is difficult for smokers to quit smoking, so it should be government responsibility to help them and make smoking situation in the country better. Government should launch a campaign that makes smoking habit be nasty and unpleasant for non-smokers in the country. If smoking habit is not acceptable in the society, smokers will not want to do so at least in public because they want to be accepted by their friends or people in the society. For example, in Thailand, government launches a smoking campaign saying that smokers smell bad and it makes smokers uncomfortable to smoke because they do not want to be smelly people and unfriended by people.
In conclusion, people continue to smoke because of nicotine addiction, and it is important for government to take serious action, such as releasing a changing-mindset campaign, to help society deal with this situation.
',
evaluation:
'Overall, this essay addresses the prompt by discussing the reasons why people continue to smoke despite the known dangers, and suggesting a solution to reduce smoking in society. However, there are several areas where improvement is needed.

Criterion 1: Task Achievement
The essay partially addresses the task by discussing the causes of why people continue to smoke and suggesting a solution to reduce smoking. However, the essay could have provided more depth and examples to support these ideas. Additionally, the essay does not fully explain how the government campaign would reduce smoking. Therefore, the task achievement criterion would be partially met.

Criterion 2: Coherence and Cohesion
The essay has a basic structure with an introduction, body paragraphs, and a conclusion. However, there is a lack of logical progression and development of ideas within paragraphs and between paragraphs. The essay would benefit from clearer topic sentences and better organization of information. Therefore, the coherence and cohesion criterion would be partially met.

Criterion 3: Lexical Resource
The essay demonstrates a basic range of vocabulary, but there is room for improvement. There is repetition of certain words and phrases, such as "smoking" and "government campaign", which could be replaced with synonyms or different expressions. Additionally, there is limited use of more advanced vocabulary and idiomatic expressions. Therefore, the lexical resource criterion would be partially met.

Criterion 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
The essay has a basic range of grammatical structures and demonstrates some control over sentence structure. However, there are several instances of grammatical errors, such as subject-verb agreement issues and incorrect verb tenses. Additionally, there is limited use of complex sentence structures and varied sentence patterns. Therefore, the grammatical range and accuracy criterion would be partially met.

Overall, based on the evaluation of the four criteria, this essay would likely score around Band 5 in the IELTS writing test.

prompt:
Prompt:
The dangers of smoking are well known, yet many people continue with this habit.What are the causes of this? How can we reduce smoking in society?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Although it is well known that smoking causes severe damage to our bodies, many people cannot reduce the bad habit. This is a big problem because many people die of lung cancer every year, and social welfare expenditures are expensive. The point is why so many people continue to smoke and how we can let them stop smoking. In this essay, I will provide two reasons and related examples to solve the questions.
First of all, once people are addicted to smoking, they cannot stop smoking without help. In my experience, my father was a heavy smoker. He wanted to quit smoking but could not do that by himself. Thus, he went to a hospital and met a well-experienced counselor. After my father got advice and medicine, he could cut the bad habit. Therefore, a counselor's help is definitely necessary.
Secondly, cigarettes are still relatively cheap compared to alcohol. For instance, tobacco was very reasonable in Japan, my home country, several decades ago. Thus, so many people had the habit of smoking rather than drinking alcohol. Then the Japanese government raised the tax rate on cigarettes from 20 percent to 50 percent in order to strongly discourage people from smoking. Consequently, the smoking rate dropped dramatically. As Japan's case shows, the rise in the tax rate is quite effective in reducing smoking in a country.
There are probably many people who have different opinions and disagree with my way of thinking. However, considering the two specific reasons and related examples indicated above, I personally believe that addiction and low price are the two main factors of smoking and that the remedies for them are a counselor's advice and raise of tax.
",
evaluation:
"Criteria for evaluation: 
1. Task Achievement - How well does the writer address the prompt and provide relevant information?
2. Coherence and Cohesion - How well are the ideas organized and connected?
3. Lexical Resource - How well does the writer use a range of vocabulary?
4. Grammar - How well does the writer use appropriate grammar and sentence structures?

Overall, this essay addresses the prompt and provides clear reasons and examples to support the writer's ideas. The ideas are organized in a logical manner and are connected well. The writer demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, although there are some repetitive phrases. The grammar is generally accurate, with only a few minor errors.

Band score suggestion: 7.0

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.Some people believe that school children should not be given homework by their teachers, whereas others argue that homework plays an important role in the education of children.Discuss both of these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
The topic of whether children should not do homework after school or definitely important to do homework plays a key role in the education of children. Although
there are many discussions around the world and some merits and demerits exists, I think that do homework is more important for children.
Initially, some people strongly argue that children should have other activities than homework. They will be able to spare time for exercise so that their body strength and immunity will be stronger. In addition, especially in Japan, some parents become aware of the Japanese educational system regarding English is not well organized. Therefore, some parents are eager to educate private English lessons for children as younger as possible after school.
On the other hand, children are struggling to catch up with their teacher's class
everyday. And they are required to learn several subjects in one day. Of course, children have a great ability to absorb a lot of memories like a sponge, but it must be hard for them to catch up with the school education curriculums because they need to learn several curriculums every weekday. Therefore, doing homework is a top priority for children to review what they learned every day. It is also effective for children by doing homework who are not so good at some subjects, like mathemathic, history, and so on. This is not only a great chance to enhance their good at subjects, and also helpful to overcome their difficult subjects. Otherwise, children will forget immediately and these weak subjects still remain as disliked subjects.
Finally, studying, including homework is boring. In contrast, it is the most important role for children to learn fundamental subjects as young as possible because some adults who did not do homework often regret they should have done when they were children. In addition, if children accumulate education by getting older, they will envision their dream what kind of occupation they would like to become.
homework is necessary for children more than anything.
",
evaluation:

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.Some people believe that school children should not be given homework by their teachers, whereas others argue that homework plays an important role in the education of children.Discuss both of these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Should Homework be given to students. Many said "yes" and many said "no". Both sides have good and strong reasons, so let's compare them wisely.
On the "homework is bad for studentsï¿½\x80\x9d side, most people argue that most homeworks is time consuming, and forces students to do it instead of spending their free time afterschool. This also keeps the students inside the house instead of letting them be active and explore the surroundings. Some even said doing homework gives tiredness, stress, and boredom, especially on exam seasons. It also slowed down the social skills development of active students. Many people agreed that homeworks and assignments should be given in another time, instead of after school time, so students could have time to rest at home.
On the other hand, "homework is good for students'' side argued that most homeworks is designed to be done in around fifteen to thirty minutes (Or in other cases thirty minutes to an hour), and students still have time to rest and enjoy their life. Also, imagine if students don't have homework, instead of playing outside, they will rather watch televisions or play video games. In fact, doing homework sharpens your skills in what you practice, like mathematics or memorizing skills.
If students can manage their time, they won't feel stressed or tired. Because they didn't do it right away, and the homework stacked up, this made them not want to do it anymore. Or because they do their homework and do other things at the same time. They will get easily distracted, but if you do it focusly, everything will be good. Also you will be prepared for the next lesson.
So I agreed that homework is good for you, as long as it is optimized and isn't time consuming. If teachers are abusing it, then it will became a good way to torture students.
',
evaluation:

However, there are several errors in grammar and sentence construction, including subject-verb agreement, tense consistency, and word order. These errors can affect the accuracy and clarity of the essay. 

Overall, based on the criteria above, the essay would likely receive a band score of 5. The essay demonstrates a basic understanding of the task and presents some ideas, but there are limitations in terms of organization, vocabulary, and grammar. To improve the score, the writer should provide a more balanced discussion of the two views, clearly state their own opinion, and work on improving sentence structure and grammar accuracy.

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.Some people believe that school children should not be given homework by their teachers, whereas others argue that homework plays an important role in the education of children.Discuss both of these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Nowadays people's opinion regarding homework for school children is that it should not be given, on the other hand some people are not agreeing. In fact, they believe that homework is a crucial part for the pupil education.
Personally speaking, I am convinced that homework are positive tools for scholar to remember and pratice what they have learnt in class, but it should be a small ratio rather than what they are currently asking.
From my personal experience, I learnt that at the school age, children do not comprehend the importance of aknolwedge information in each different courses. As a result of it, pupil only focus on what they like, discarting subjects that are not in their taste and this is when homework plays a fundamental part. It helps scholar to fix in their memories the lesson they attended and from there building more ideas about it. Consequently, following the next courses will be easier for them. Not only does it help them to learn what has been thought, but also it gives them a method of study and habits which will be crucial for university or personal aknwoledgement. It set up the base to thrive on their own in the future.
Having said that, it is understandable if some people are against homework. Teachers might be given a heavy homework load to students, which is unfair because the children should also have the time to enjoy their childhood, playing and having fun. On the other hand, saying no to homework in their full is incorrect. If scholar are not having any homework, they will lose opportunity to learn and in the long run it will affect their productivities.
To conclude, I strongly believe that the benefits of homework outweigh the drawbacks. Therefore, homework should be given in order to allow student to understand how to flourish indipendently, but simultaneously, the amount of homework load should be re-evaluated.
",
evaluation:

Band Score: 5

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.Some people believe that school children should not be given homework by their teachers, whereas others argue that homework plays an important role in the education of children.Discuss both of these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Due to the importance of education there is always a debate on how best to teach. The biggest discussion point is homework. Even though it sometimes can apply too much pressure on the students, it helps process the materials better and prepares students for adult life.
One of the main drawback of homework is the amount of time and effort it usually requiers. In a lot of schools homework takes at least several hours to do which can be a lot after a long school day. Another issue with homework are the mark that students get because the can affect a mental health of a developing child a lot.
However, homework can help students work on their skills and give a deeper understanding of the subject in question. Homework can be very helpful when a student is sick or absent in the class to process all the materials at home. It is also very common situation when a struggling student raised his marks by doing homework which improved his skills in a long run.
Personally, I think homework is essential part of schooling. It teaches you responsibility, for example by meeting your deadlines, and helps process knowledge that you gained in class. In addition, homework teaches teenagers to learn which is the most important skill everyone should gain at school.
Thus, even though homework can sometimes take a lot of time and don't give a desired mark in return, it prepares students for an adult tasks such as projects at work and strict deadlines.
",

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.Some people believe that school children should not be given homework by their teachers, whereas others argue that homework plays an important role in the education of children.Discuss both of these views and give your own opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Nowadays, schools around the world are exploring new pedagogical methodologies. Traditionally, schools have used homeworks as a pivotal tool to support childrenÂ´s education. However, in the past few years, some schools have piloted a homework-free approach. I believe that homework-based schools provide a more nurturing and effective education compared with homework-free schools.
Having homework most of the days helps children to develop their discipline. They might be interested in other activities like seeing friends or playing video games. However, children must learn to prioritize their homework over other activities, which promotes discipline. Similarly, if they want to do things different than their homework, children need to plan and adjust their time, thus learning valuable skills such as time-management. Both skills, discipline and time-management, will help children to perform better later in life. Additionally, it is reasonable to think that children who do their homework will be exposed to study topics for a longer period of time, thus deepening their learning experience. Therefore, they will be more knowledgeable in the future. Finally, one can expect that children who do their homework will be used to working for longer periods of time, which will be helpful during their transition to university and the working life.
On the other hand, homework-free schools also have advantages. These children will have more time at home to explore their own interests and hobbies. They could learn skills not typically taught at school like photography or singing. Since most children dislike homework, one could also hypothetize that children attending a homework-free school would be happier. Finally, one can expect that these children would be less stresssed.
To conclude, homework-based schools have more advantages for children than homework-free schools. Therefore, homeworks are still an important tool to improve the learning experience of children around the world.
',
evaluation:
'Criteria 1: Task Achievement
The essay effectively addresses the prompt by discussing both the advantages of giving homework to school children and the advantages of a homework-free approach. The writer gives reasons and examples to support their own opinion. The essay stays on topic and provides a clear stance on the issue. 
Score: 8

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion
The essay is well-organized with clear paragraphs and logical progression of ideas. The writer uses transition words and phrases to connect ideas and create a cohesive flow. However, there are some minor grammar and punctuation errors that slightly affect the overall coherence. 
Score: 7
