Nowadays the sentences that judges give to criminals is always at the centre of attention of the society; some people think that the best way to reduce the amount of crime cases is to give longer prison sentences, while, others say that there are other alternative ways to stop it. This essay will talk about both views and, at the end, I will give my opinion about the argument.
It is always more common to see long sentences for criminals, also if their crimes are not too bad to deserve that type of punishment; the reason why the court gives to them long sentences is because they think that staying a lot in prison will make the criminals understand that what they did is wrong and, next time, they will think twice before doing something bad or against the law.
However long sentences can go against the human rights because they will take away from prisoners years of their life; for this reason, some people think that it can be better if, instead of stay close in a jail without doing nothing, they can be used in various works that will make them useful for the society and better person at the end of the sentence, like cleaning the city, helping old people in retirement homes and also cook for poor people.
I think that there are other ways to stop crime instead of giving long punishments, also because everyone should have a second chance in their life and, more importantly, teach and show to prisoners different aspects of the community will help cities to become better places with less crimes to stop.
This essay talked about two different types of views about crime sentences in our society, with my own opinion about the argument in the last part of it.
',
evaluation:
"Overall, the essay addresses the prompt and provides arguments for both views. The ideas presented are relevant and supported by some examples. However, there are several issues with the essay that affect its clarity and coherence. 

Firstly, the introduction is weak and lacks a clear thesis statement. It would be better to clearly state the two views and the writer's opinion in the introduction to provide a roadmap for the essay. 

Secondly, the essay lacks proper organization and paragraph structure. The ideas are not well-developed and the essay jumps from one idea to another without clear transitions. Each paragraph should focus on a single point and provide evidence or examples to support it.

Thirdly, there are grammar and punctuation errors throughout the essay, which affect the overall clarity of the writing. For example, there are errors in subject-verb agreement and the use of articles. These errors can make it difficult for the reader to understand the intended meaning.

Finally, the vocabulary and sentence structures used in the essay are limited. There is a lack of variety in sentence length and complexity, and some sentences are awkwardly phrased. More sophisticated vocabulary and sentence structures would enhance the coherence and cohesion of the essay.

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 5 for this essay. While the essay addresses the prompt and presents arguments for both views, the lack of organization, grammar errors, and limited vocabulary and sentence structures bring down the overall score.

prompt:
Prompt:
In many workplaces, online communication is getting more common than meeting face to face. Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?

Essay: 
According to COVID-19 event forced many company to change their way of working. One of the most significant transformation is the communication. The online communication becomes a must or inevitable for the company to be implemented. In this topic, we're going to disscuss the advantages and disadvantages for both ways of communications. The online meeting can introduce a significant impact to the organization while face to face meeting can be outdated for this new era of 2021.
First of all for the online communication's advantages is that in the pandemic period the actual physical contact is a significant way to transmit the disease. Video conference can help mitigate this problem by lower the physical contact for each conversation or meeting. Also communicates through online channel can help individual to organize or manage their time efficiently according to each person preference. For example, a single mom parent may be able to spend times for her sons/daughters at home, while be able to have a cross country meeting with another department in other region. Another reason is that some people are quite introvert and find it difficult for face to face human interactions or conversations, in which online chat or messages can help them to mitigate this problem and communicate efficiently. Lastly as mentioned about video conference across region, online meeting can help the multi-national corporates save the transporations cost and additional resources needed to spend for face to face meeting.
For the disadvantages, all of the online communications required hardware, internet connection and technological knowledge on how to use them. This technological gap can be seen as one of the most significant obstracle or disadvantage for people to use online communications. For example, in one company, there obviously have a various age of people, in which some of them are not familiar with the technology. Since video call conference has been introduced and utilized widespread among corporates not so long time ago. This can be a big technological gap for some people to use the online communications and result in a lost in communications among the workplaces.
As a result, online communication helps an organization to reduce the risk of transmitting the disease, improved the time mangement ability and productivity for each individuals, and lower the financial cost or resources required to spends for international business activities. With all these advantages of online communication stated, they can be seens as a significant reasons to outweight the disadvantages of technological gap on this current year of 2021.
",
evaluation:
'Criterion 1: Task Achievement
The essay addresses the prompt and provides an argument about whether the advantages of online communication outweigh the disadvantages. The writer discusses both the advantages and disadvantages of online communication in the workplace. However, the essay could have provided a more balanced evaluation of the advantages and disadvantages.

Criterion 2: Coherence and Cohesion
The essay is generally coherent and cohesive. The writer uses appropriate transition words and phrases to connect ideas. However, there are some grammatical errors and awkward sentence structures that affect the overall clarity of the essay.

Criterion 3: Lexical Resource
The writer demonstrates an adequate range of vocabulary, using words and phrases relevant to the topic. However, there are instances of repetition and some unclear or awkward word choices.

Criterion 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
The essay contains a range of grammatical structures, including complex sentences and conditional sentences. However, there are several grammatical errors throughout the essay that affect the accuracy and clarity of the writing.

Overall, based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 5.5 for this essay. The essay addresses the prompt and presents arguments, but lacks balance in evaluating the advantages and disadvantages. Additionally, there are issues with coherence, vocabulary, and grammar that impact the overall quality of the writing.

prompt:
Prompt:
In many workplaces, online communication is getting more common than meeting face to face. Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?

Essay: 
With new technologies come new ways to communicate with people. First, we had emails and now we have social media and a variety of different apps that give us the opportunity to chat with one another. And this kind of online communication entered not only our personal but also our professional life. This topic is rather controversial and people have different opinions about that, so in this essay, I'm gonna be talking about pros and cons of the new type of working communication.
First, I would like to start with some advantages of online communication at work. In my opinion, the main thing that makes people go from meeting face to face to talk online is the fact that it's more convenient. We don't have to set a specific date to meet someone. And also we can talk to someone from wherever we want, without needing to drive to the office. The two things we need are our cellphone or computer and the internet connection. But I think nowadays it won't be a problem for anyone because the majority of people have each of this stuff.
The second advantage - the functionality of apps for online communication. Let's take Zoom. I think almost everyone used this app in 2020 during lockdowns all over the world, including myself. You can arrange a meeting with thousands of people, using this app. This is much easier than gathering large amounts of people in one place. You can also record this meeting if you wish and send this recording to people who were absent or use it yourself in the future to remember all the details. Face to face meetings do not provide us with all these opportunities.
If we talk about disadvantages, I do not see a lot of them. The only thing that we can miss in online communication is the ability to see human emotions and facial expressions. I find it really important, especially when it comes to discussing important projects or deals. From my own experience, I can say that when there was a lockdown in my country due to the pandemic, I missed physical interaction with my colleagues, such as handshaking, etc. I find physical interaction to be an effective way for team building, so it's might be hard to work without it, using only online communication.
To conclude, I would say that everyone can have different opinions about whether it's better to meet online or face to face. But what I am sure about is that we should not get rid of face to face meetings completely. Otherwise, It will be hard to keep the team tigh-knit.
",
evaluation:
'Criteria 1: Task Achievement

The essay adequately addresses the prompt and presents both the advantages and disadvantages of online communication in the workplace. However, the writer could have provided more specific examples or evidence to support their points. 

Score: 6

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion

The essay is generally well-organized and coherent. The writer uses transition words and phrases to connect ideas and paragraphs. However, the essay lacks a clear introduction and conclusion. A stronger introduction that provides a clear thesis statement and a conclusion that summarizes the main points would improve the overall cohesion of the essay. 

Score: 6.5

Criteria 3: Lexical Resource

The writer demonstrates an adequate range of vocabulary and uses some less common words and phrases, such as "controversial" and "functionality." However, there are also instances of repetitive language, such as using "online communication" multiple times. Additionally, there are a few errors in word choice, such as using "tigh-knit" instead of "tight-knit" in the conclusion. 

Score: 6

Criteria 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy

The writer generally uses correct grammar and sentence structures. However, there are a few errors in subject-verb agreement and verb tense consistency, such as using "the main thing that makes" instead of "the main thing that make" and "we should not get rid" instead of "we should not get rid of." Overall, the essay demonstrates a good understanding of grammar with only minor errors. 

Score: 7

Based on these evaluations, I would suggest a band score of 6.5 for this essay.

prompt:
Prompt:
In many workplaces, online communication is getting more common than meeting face to face. Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?

Essay: 
With the advent of the internet and later the video-call technology, life has dramatically changed, particularly in work circles as plenty of meetings have been held online rather than in offices and huge halls. In this essay, I will count the possible advantages as well as some disadvantages of such an invention and finally conclude wether or not it is really a cost-effective one.
Over the course of modern history, national and international conferrences have cost enormous funds in order to gather experts from all over the world. However, thanks to the available online communication platforms, present companies and foundations can hold meetings with famous and influencial persons more often and with less expense. Furthermore, nowadays, employees can spare the time spent on travelling between offices and premises, by having online meetings. Meetings are now recorded for documentation and any future purposes. For example, this technology has seemd to be critical on our life, specifcally since the outbreak of COVID19. If humans had not have this means of communication, there would have been more severe and devastating effects on businesses.
On the other hand, there is another aspect which merits further consideration. Unfortunately, techincal network problems could still happen and cause inevitable cancellations. Moreover, meeting other colleagues merely on screens would have a detrimental social impact in workplaces. Without face-to-face interaction peers have less chance to build strong and deep relationships, which in turn might weaken co-opeartion and cohesion in any work environment.
To recapitulate, as we weigh up the pros and cons of this recent innovation, I strongly believe that the prominent advantages outweigh the few disadvantages that I mentioned above. Still, precautions should be taken to identify the possible drawbacks in order to offset their converse effects on many workplaces.
',
evaluation:
'Criteria 1: Task Achievement

The essay effectively addresses the prompt by discussing the advantages and disadvantages of online communication in the workplace. The writer provides specific examples and makes a clear argument that the advantages outweigh the disadvantages. The main points are well-developed and supported.

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion

The essay is well-organized and easy to follow. The writer uses appropriate paragraphing and linking words to connect ideas. The introduction and conclusion effectively summarize the main points and provide a clear overall structure.

Criteria 3: Lexical Resource

The writer demonstrates a good range of vocabulary and uses appropriate language to express ideas. There are a few minor errors or word choices that could be improved, but overall, the writer effectively conveys their message.

Criteria 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy

The essay has a good range of sentence structures and demonstrates a good level of grammatical accuracy. There are a few minor errors or awkward phrasings, but they do not significantly affect the overall clarity of the essay.

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 7. The essay effectively addresses the prompt, has a clear overall structure, demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, and shows a good level of grammatical accuracy.

Essay: 
Today we live in the pandemia world, even if several countries don't have a high risk of infection for the majority of its population. We stiil sit at home rather then go to a restorant with friends and a lot of companies still keep their offices locked.
On the one hand office workers from all over the world opened the possibility of working from home. This option gives you more freedom and diversity of places from wich you can do your job: you can meet with your collegues from cafe or library, from kitchen or bedroom. Also, we were forced to keep our social nets with online tools, to communicate with our friends and families. Now we all learned to use such programmes like Zoom or Skype to speak with each other. Probably if we hadn't the Covid, we would struggle bigger difficulties when someone from our buddies would come to another country or town, but now we all know what to do with this, how to keep in touch. We also got to appreciate the power of touching more then before, because we were missing it for these long monthes. How it was nice to hug an old friend after long quarantine!
On the other hand we really weaned from normal offline communication. And we can't evaluate how many people started to think that online is absolute substitute of offline. It's obviosly not like that. During online meeting it's impossible to have a normal common discussion because it needs to have only one person speaking. Also people lack of possibility to see each others eyes, so they don't feel enough contact with each other.
As a conclusion it is possible to say that situation with increasing popularuty of online meetings is ambivalent. This type of communication save our connections with each other during the pandemia, but there is a risk of substitution real meetings by online in the situations when it is not appropriate. As far I am concerned, I think that advantages outweight disadvantages, but we need to use online communication properly.
",

prompt:
Prompt:
Some educationalists say that every child should be taught how to play a musical instrument. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Essay: 
Education is one of the most important topics for childhood development, and music can be very beneficial to children because it helps to sustain creative thinking and improve imagination. Some educators demand that music should be taught as a mandatory subject, and yet some others think that forcing children to play music instruments will limit their chances to discover and develop other talents.
Indeed, music can be a great source for improving the lives of many children as well as their learning experience. Learning music instruments requires patience, creativity and good discipline. Inherently, in order to master a music instrument, a good musician needs to sharpen his preserverence and offer all his best, for a great performance often demands ten or more years of practice. The heart of a musician, the pursuation of perfection and persistence are all good qualities for a child to learn throughout his life in pursuing his career, not only the career in music.
However, despite all the good qualities that can be obtained through playing music instruments, childhood education can be misdirected if the development of a hobbie becomes "mandatory", which, of ocurse, includes music instruments. It might be beneficial for a child to experiment music instruments in his early years, but not every child has the potential of being a professional musician. Making music a mandatory subject for primary and secondary school students could minimize their opportunities to discover different hobbies. Moreover, making a bobbie a mandatory subject may also hinder the other learning experiences of a young child. Just imagine how stressful it is to study an unecessary subject on top of regular courses and other homework. It does more harms than goods to the overall learning experience.
In conclusion, it might be beneficial for a child to learn music instruments in his first school years, but if he does not have the talent and does not enjoy music, educators should consider dropping such suggestion and let him discover other hobbies.
',
evaluation:
"Criteria 1: Task Achievement
The essay addresses the task prompt by discussing the benefits of teaching children how to play a musical instrument and also considering the potential limitations of making it a mandatory subject. The writer presents a clear stance on the issue and provides arguments to support their opinion.

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion
The essay is well-organized, with an introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. Each paragraph focuses on a specific point and there is a logical flow of ideas throughout the essay. Transitions are used effectively to connect ideas within and between paragraphs.

Criteria 3: Lexical Resource
The writer demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, using words and phrases appropriately. There are some instances of repetition and some more advanced vocabulary could be used, but overall the vocabulary is sufficient to convey the writer's ideas.

Criteria 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
The majority of the essay is grammatically correct, with a range of sentence structures and appropriate use of verb tenses. There are a few errors in subject-verb agreement and word order, but they do not significantly hinder understanding.

Overall, considering the above criteria, this essay would likely score around a band 7. There is a clear opinion, good organization of ideas, and effective use of vocabulary and grammar. However, there is room for improvement in terms of vocabulary variety and more consistent grammatical accuracy.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some educationalists say that every child should be taught how to play a musical instrument. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Essay: 
It is commonly known that music has always played an important role in upbringing of children and a lot of parents wish their kids play a musical instrument. However, I disagree that this skill is essential to every pupil.
First of all, not all people are born with a talent for music, which is essential if one wants to learn how to play it. Some people are natural musicians and succeed in this sphere with ease. On the other hand, there are children for whom learning to play is a hard work and, eventually, they might start hating music instead of enjoying it. Some people are bound to become excellent engineers or doctors and for them learning to read and play music is just a waste of time.
Another important factor is that all kids are different and for that reason each of them desires to have a different hobby. If all pupils spent time on music, those who are not interested in it would have less time on things that are really exciting for them. Undoubtedly, everybody has a right to spend their free time in the way they want.
What is more, playing a musical instrument is not considered to be an essential skill for a successful career. More time should be devoted to more important subjects, such as Math, Science and Languages. These have more chance to be useful for people when they grow up and graduate from school.
To sum up, teaching all children to play an instrument wouldn't be a good idea. It should be taught only to those who really want it as not only would it ditract a child from subjects and hobbies which are more important in their opinion, but also it cannot be mastered by everybody.
",
evaluation:
'Overall, this essay addresses the prompt and provides a clear opinion. The arguments are supported with reasons, and there is a logical flow in the essay. However, there are some areas for improvement.

1. Task Achievement: 
The essay adequately addresses the prompt by stating the opinion and providing reasons to support it. The arguments presented are relevant to the topic and show a clear understanding of the task. The essay provides a balanced view by acknowledging that not all children have a talent for music.

The ideas are presented in a logical order, and there is a good use of linking words to connect the sentences and paragraphs. However, some of the ideas could be further developed and expanded upon to enhance coherence.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?

Essay: 
There are a lot of research about development in human life, Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. In the following paragraph, I will discuss both view and give my opinion.
On the one hands, There has a research that bad experience in children before begining at school, especcially in family, will become unforgettable deep heart. For example, Children who live with strict parents and has aggressive punishment when children doing littie wrong things. In the future, Children will tend to aggressive and feeling they has not received a love from family. This research surely reasonnable because family is an important factor of social life.
On the other hands, There have an opinion even if children was velvet glove when raised with family. However, Especially in adolescent, Friend and teacher can infleuence as same as family because teenagers spend more time at school that with family as a reason learning in classroom more than primary school and have a more group work with friend. Thus, If teenager prefer to close with a good student (not smoking or drinking alcohol / invite classroom friends travel education museum in weekends or holiday), Parents can make sure that your child will mature to standard adults.
In conclusion, In my opinion, Children would be infleuenced by family before begining at school. After that, They will has a lot of complex relationship in school from friends and teachers that can infleuences children. So, Children should try to control yourself in moral to be a best quality adults.
',
evaluation:
"Overall, this essay demonstrates a basic understanding of the prompt and attempts to discuss both views and provide a personal opinion. However, there are several areas that need improvement in order to meet the criteria of IELTS writing.

1. Task Achievement:
The essay partially addresses the prompt by discussing both views on whether experiences before starting school or experiences as a teenager are more influential. However, the essay lacks a clear structure and organization, making it difficult for the reader to follow the arguments. Therefore, the essay does not fully achieve the task.

2. Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay lacks coherence and cohesion due to the absence of clear paragraphs and logical progression of ideas. The use of transitional phrases and linking words is limited, resulting in a disjointed flow of information. This affects the overall coherence and cohesion of the essay.

3. Lexical Resource:
The essay contains several grammatical errors and improper word choices. There are instances of incorrect verb tenses and sentence structure, which affect the overall clarity and coherence of the essay. Additionally, there is a lack of vocabulary range and precision, resulting in repetitive language and limited use of academic vocabulary.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
As mentioned earlier, the essay demonstrates a lack of grammatical accuracy. There are errors in subject-verb agreement, article usage, and sentence structure. These errors hinder the reader's understanding and undermine the writer's ability to convey their ideas effectively.

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 4 for this essay. While there is an attempt to address the prompt and present arguments, the lack of coherence, grammatical errors, and limited vocabulary usage prevent the essay from achieving a higher band score.

prompt:

Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?

Essay: 
There are opposite views as to which stage of life would exert the most influence on a child's life. Some people hold that the pre-school life is the most influential, while others disagree and claim that the teenage life, notably the period of staying at school, would be more important to his/her life. This essay is to evaluate both views and demonstrate my opinion.
Before entering the school, children usually receive the most influence from their parents and friends. At home, children would spend much time with their parents teaching them a variety of knowledge needed to help an adolescent act properly and get recognised by the society in the future. When staying outside, children would also be influenced by their friends or other peers since children tend to resemble the behaviours of their peers in order to integrate into the social group of adolescents.
In the school life, a child's personality would be shaped both by classmates who frequently interact with the child and potentially affect the child, and by teachers presenting knowledge in various fields of science and liberal arts so as to help the child obtain a basic understanding to the world.
As far as I am concerned, it is rather arbitrary to conclude which period of life would be more important than the other, since a child's psychological development is too complex to be understood. After all, the importance of pre-school life or teenage period might vary from one child to another. Children have their respective understandings as to which person deserves their admiration and which period of life teaches them the best lesson.
To sum up, children would be influenced by different persons in different periods of life. It depends on children's own intention as to which period is more pivotal, and which person should be admired.
",
evaluation:
'Criteria for evaluation:

1. Task response: The essay addresses the prompt by discussing both views and giving the writer's own opinion. The writer evaluates both views and concludes that it is arbitrary to determine which period of life is more important. The essay fulfills the requirements of the prompt.

2. Coherence and cohesion: The essay is well-structured with clear paragraphs and logical progression of ideas. The writer uses appropriate linking words and phrases to connect ideas and paragraphs. The essay flows smoothly and is easy to follow.

3. Lexical resource: The writer demonstrates a good range of vocabulary and uses a variety of words and phrases to express ideas. There are no major issues with word choice or usage. The writer also uses some academic vocabulary, such as "influence," "adolescent," and "pivotal," which enhances the essay's overall language quality.

4. Grammar: The essay shows good control of grammar with minimal errors. The sentences are mostly error-free and well-constructed. There are a few minor mistakes, such as missing articles and incorrect verb forms, but they do not significantly affect the overall quality of the essay.

Overall, this essay demonstrates a good understanding of the prompt, has a clear and coherent structure, uses a wide range of vocabulary, and has minimal grammar errors. Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 7.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?

Essay: 
Childhood memories are one of the most memorable experiences for many children. Some of people argue that these memories are highly influenced the children on their future life. In contrary many said that experiences occurred during teenage perod Ã Â¹\x89have much more impact to their future. In this essay will disscuss on both point of view and will show some supportive opinions that experiences during the time at school are highly impact futher development in the future for many teenagers.
On one hand, it is the fact that experiences or events happend during their childhood or before they starting to go to school can highly attached to their memories. For example, children would be able to remember the situation where they felt the most insecure or scared, for example, some scary movies or fear of some animals. In which will be further more becomes their wound in their heart. However, these experiences can be erradicated or overcame after in their life and left with just some funny moments for them in the future. Also some of these memories might be erased from their thought since the events appeared during the first recent year of their life could be easily forgettable.
On the other hand, there are higher varieties of experiences occurred during teenage stage of life, in which are more recognizable both from an external factors like their friends, family or their environments in school. And also from their individuals experiences, for example, teenagers are able to realize some of the failure or mistakes that happened in their life such as their examinations failure. In addition to that, some of events might able to happend during the teenages time only, for example, their first love or their first boyfriend/girlfriend. Incorporate all these experiences which can in turn influence their future decision making and their development path in their life.
In conclusion, the experiences occurred as a teenagers are more influence their future life from the fact the varieties of events or situations can take place during this period of time and also some memories that happend during the time before starting school are easily forgettable or overcame.
',
evaluation:
"Overall, the essay addresses the prompt and presents arguments supporting both views. However, there are several areas that need improvement.

1. Task Achievement: The essay discusses both views and provides examples to support them. However, the arguments lack depth and coherence. The essay does not clearly state the writer's opinion, which is required in the prompt.

2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay lacks organization and coherence. There are several grammar errors and the ideas are not presented in a logical order. Additionally, there are some repetitive phrases and unclear sentences that make it difficult to follow the writer's train of thought.

3. Lexical Resource: The vocabulary used in the essay is limited and repetitive. The writer needs to use a wider range of vocabulary and avoid using the same words and phrases repeatedly.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy: The essay contains numerous grammatical errors, including incorrect verb tenses, missing articles, and incorrect word order. The writer needs to work on improving their grammar skills to communicate their ideas more effectively.

Band Score: Based on the above evaluation, I would suggest a band score of 4 for this essay. The essay demonstrates basic competence in addressing the prompt and presenting arguments, but the lack of coherence, vocabulary range, and grammatical accuracy hinders the overall effectiveness of the essay.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?

Essay: 
The experiences a child goes through during different stages of life defines his personality and have great impact on his future. Some people argue that those experiences which a child faces before entering into school has more effect, whereas others believe that teenhood has profound influence on a child's future life. This essay will discuss in detail both the views and explain why i believe that both early childhood and teenage experiences decide what future holds for the child.
Those people, who are in opinion that experiences in early childhood before the start of school has impact on future life, give several reasons. They believe that whatever a child faces at home helps in shaping his personality. For example, abusive childhood greatly has long lasting effect on their lives. It has been studied that those children who are victims of child abuse are more likely to become criminals. Some of them can never return towards normal life. Moreover, parents by their care and love can raise a child with a bright future. These children know the world from the perspective of their parents and it helps them to become a well-mannered and cultured human being with specific life goals, such as getting higher education or finding a job. In short, early childhood has its far reaching effects on a child.
On the other hand, people, who think that teenage experiences , especially at school, have more impact on determining the future of the person, have their own reasons to support their argument. Firstly, it is the phase of life where hormonal changes are taking place and they are experiencing body changes both mentally and physically; therefore, those who can have control on their emotions during this phase can develop as a strong individual. Secondly, it is the phase where most of the teenagers start taking decisions about their future study choices and any study experience at school help them in making these decisions. Such resolutions in teenage can have impact on their future practical lives. Finally, those youngsters, who are bullied during their teenhood at school, can suffer from personality disorder later in their lives which can have detrimental affect on their future. Surely, these experiences in teenage can affect a child's future.
To conclude, i believe that both pre-school childhood and teenage experiences help shape the future of a person. It is the experiences in both of these phases of lives which influence a child's future.
",
evaluation:
"Overall, this essay demonstrates a good understanding of the prompt and presents a balanced discussion of both views. The writer provides clear reasons to support each viewpoint and offers examples to illustrate their points. However, there are some areas for improvement.

1. Task Achievement: The essay addresses the prompt by discussing both views and giving the writer's opinion. The arguments are relevant and well-developed. However, there is no clear introduction or conclusion, which affects the overall structure of the essay.

2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay generally flows well, with clear topic sentences and appropriate linking words. However, there are a few instances where the organization could be improved for better clarity and coherence.

3. Lexical Resource: The writer uses a range of vocabulary and phrases, demonstrating a good command of language. However, some sentences could be more concise and precise. Additionally, there is some repetition of ideas and words, which could be avoided.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy: The essay shows a good range of sentence structures and grammatical accuracy. However, there are a few minor errors in sentence construction and word usage. Proofreading could help in identifying and correcting these errors.

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 6.5. The essay demonstrates a good level of language proficiency and addresses the prompt effectively, but there is room for improvement in terms of structure, vocabulary, and grammar.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people say that the experiences a child has before starting school have the most influence on their future life. Others say that experiences as a teenager, especially at school, are more influential. Discuss both views and give your own opinion?

Essay: 
An outstanding youth which most of parents wish their son or daughter to be especially Asian parents who attempt to cultivate their next generation at any cost. Some believe a child possesses experiences which before starting school have the most important on their future life whereas some advocate the experiences of teenagers most notably their school life are more influential.
To start with the infant to 3 years old is a period of the strongest absorptive capacity. Some think this is the best time to let children learn the different aspect of knowledges and new things. Indeed, it is vital process for a child to explore surrounding events by their infant curiosity. In this period, parents actively encourage their children to cope with new things and embrace their faults that can build up their confidence. This enable a child is willing to face any challenges which he/ she may not be familiar with. It is very important manner to adapt new enviroments and to figure out the solution when they encounter the difficulties in their future life.
Apparently, teenagers begin to step into adolescence, which is a transitional phase of growth and development between childhood and adulthood. It includes some big changes to the body and to the way a young person relates to the world. The many physical, sexual, cognitive, social and emotional changes that happen during this time can bring anticipation and anxiety for adolescents and their families. Simultaneously, they treasure the friendship with mates. It makes the youths to spend much time into their school life that occupy a chunk of their daily time. It cannot be denied that period is an indispensable experience in the whole life.
From my perspective, life stages from the infant to the elderly are different and influence on us as each phases is new adaption and inevitable changes to our bodies and to the way what we live. But the important thing is what attitudes we have when facing such changes, so called as experiences.
',
evaluation:
"Criteria 1: Task Achievement/Response
The essay addresses the prompt by discussing both views on which experiences have the most influence on a person's future life â€“ those before starting school and those during the teenage years, particularly at school. The writer gives their own opinion at the end by stating that different life stages have different influences, but the important thing is how individuals approach these changes. The response adequately covers the main points of the prompt.

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion
The essay lacks proper organization and structure. The ideas are presented in a fragmented manner, making it difficult for the reader to follow the writer's train of thought. The essay would benefit from clear topic sentences and paragraphs to improve the overall coherence and cohesion.

Criteria 3: Lexical Resource
The vocabulary used in the essay is generally appropriate, with some instances of incorrect word choice and awkward phrasing. There is a need for more precise vocabulary to express ideas clearly. Additionally, there are several grammatical errors throughout the essay that need to be corrected.

Criteria 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
As mentioned earlier, there are several grammatical errors throughout the essay, including subject-verb agreement issues, incorrect verb forms, and sentence structure mistakes. These errors hinder the clarity and accuracy of the essay.

Overall, considering the criteria for IELTS writing, this essay would likely score in the band 5 range. The content is relevant to the prompt, but the lack of organization, vocabulary limitations, and grammatical errors hold back the overall effectiveness of the essay.

prompt:
Prompt:
It is suggested that primary children should learn how to grow vegetables and keep animals. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?

Essay: 
It is important to experiance and learn certian kind of habits at younge age for children to develop them as they grow older. Growing vegetables and taking care of animals are two main practices children should develop at their younger age. In this essay I will discuss some disadvatages that would affect children during this process and explain why I feel that there are better advatages.
The most significant advatage of learning to grow vegetables is that children will initally start to understand the importance of eating healthy and also the process of growing vegetables. In this case children will learn not to waste food and how hard and the effort it takes to grow these vegetables. It is important that we keep reminding children from their primary age so that they will remember and practice as they grow older. Taking care of animals is another important thing that children should learn in their primary , this will teach children to care for others and not be frighten of animals. Furthermore, they will learn to respect animals and love them.
Some of the disadvantages of keeping animals is that some children has different types of allergies which will lead them to be more sick. However, some animals tend to be more dangerous than others. Another disadvatages is that when growing vegetables the compost and pestisides are dangerous to children or it might sometime be allergic to them as well. Insect bites during planting will also lead children to get sick.
In conclusion it is important to learn how to grow vegetables and take care of animals at their younger age since they develop certain habits and learn more indeapth which will be helpful as they grow older. Eventhough, some argue that it is more riskier for children I believe that the advatages outweight disadvatages.
',
evaluation:
'Criteria 1: Task Achievement

The essay addresses the prompt by discussing both the advantages and disadvantages of primary children learning to grow vegetables and keep animals. The writer states that they will discuss the disadvantages but does not provide a balanced discussion, as the advantages are only briefly mentioned. The essay does not clearly state whether the advantages outweigh the disadvantages. 

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion

The essay is organized into three paragraphs, with each paragraph focusing on a different point. However, there are some issues with coherence and cohesion. The introduction and conclusion are not clearly developed, and there is limited use of linking words and phrases to connect ideas.

Criteria 3: Lexical Resource

The essay demonstrates a basic range of vocabulary, with some repetition and lack of variety. There are also some errors in word choice, such as "experiance," "certian," and "disadvatages." Additionally, some words are misspelled, such as "indeapth" instead of "in-depth."

Criteria 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy

There are several grammatical errors throughout the essay, such as incorrect verb conjugation ("experiance," "growed," "has," "advatages") and incorrect sentence structure ("some children has," "it might sometime be allergic to them"). There are also some issues with subject-verb agreement and verb tense consistency.

Overall, based on these criteria, this essay would likely receive a band score of 4.

prompt:
Prompt:
It is suggested that primary children should learn how to grow vegetables and keep animals. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?

Essay: 
In primary school, especially in the countryside in Japan, primary students have an opportunity to learn how to plant and grow vegetables. In addition, students need to feed and observe animal growth and health. This is a great advantage for children to enrich their knowledge of how essential our lives consist in society. It is obviously advantageous than disadvantages.
Firstly, the procedures to grow vegetables take a long time from cultivating the soil to harvesting vegetables when they grew up. This means that it is great education for children on how to produce our food and agriculture industries have been paying an outstanding effort and time. This education causes students to become aware of the necessity of gratitude to people who are working in these industries.
In addition, it is also mandatory to keep animals in a good condition is worthwhile as young as possible. Animals also have lives, and their lives easily devastate unless they are fed. This is also the same in human lives. Young children will be able to recognize how sensitive to keeping animals a good condition, and be more respectful to their own parents and how deep love they give to children. As a result they are more willing to give a hand who need help.
Finally, these activities, such as growing vegetables and keeping animals are not only helpful to learn what our society consists of, but also more educational for children firsthand, instead of watching documental TV programs. Through these activities, children will become aware of current issues, for example, food consumerism, extinction of animal species, global warming, and so on. If they learned as young as possible, the number of people who are concerned and make specific actions for these issues will increase. As a result, our lifestyle will improve more peacefully.

The writer provides three main points to support their argument and includes examples and explanations to further develop these points. However, there are several areas where the essay could be improved.

prompt:
Prompt:
It is suggested that primary children should learn how to grow vegetables and keep animals. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?

Essay: 
Some people believe that young children ought to breed animals and plant vegetables. This essay will argue about some pros and cons of children working as farmers, and also show that disadvantages overtake the benefits of it.
One the one hand, it is a fact that young children who work looking after animals and plants learn how to respect the environment and develop an elevated sense of responsability. Certainly, activities such as taking care of animals and grow vegetables favour children in many aspects of their lives, like to have a better health, mostly because of doing lots of outdoor activities and eating healthier food than city children.
On the other hand, if children learn how to work as a farmer, they could try to do it alone, without any supervision, which is surely a hard work, with a lot of difficult and responsabilties. In order words, those tasks could be dangerous to a child and affect negatively its live. For example, it is necessary to use some special tools to deal with vegetables, and those tools could harm easily a child. In addition, looking after animals and plants take too much time and children must spend their time studying and having fun instead of working.
In conclusion, although the benefits that people can find in teaching young children to deal with animals and grow vegetables, the disadvantanges of children doing those tasks are extremely high, because of some permanent damages which could be caused by dangerous tools. In my opinion, young children should learn how to do it but they must not do those activities even if they were supervised by adults.
',
evaluation:

2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay lacks proper organization and coherence. The ideas are presented in a disorganized manner, which makes it difficult to follow the writer's train of thought. Additionally, there are several grammatical and structural errors that affect the overall coherence of the essay.

3. Lexical Resource: The essay demonstrates a basic range of vocabulary, but there are some errors and repetitive word choices. It would benefit from using more varied vocabulary and avoiding repetitive phrases.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy: There are several grammatical errors throughout the essay, including incorrect verb tenses, subject-verb agreement issues, and word order errors. These errors affect the clarity and accuracy of the writing.

Overall, based on the above analysis, this essay would likely receive a band score of 4.0 on the IELTS writing test. It demonstrates some understanding of the topic, but the lack of organization, coherence, and grammatical errors lower its overall score.

prompt:
Prompt:
It is suggested that primary children should learn how to grow vegetables and keep animals. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?

Essay: 
Nowadays, it is widely believed that education has become an important aspect of our lives, especially for primary children, which have to be well educated before achieving the period of adolescence. Furthermore, I hold on firmly to the belief that, children should learn how to respect the environment, especially the agriculture such as vegetables and the wildlife as animals.
To begin with, children should learn how to cultivate and grow vegetables, in order to respect the environment. In other words, children may experience some extra activities related to plants cultivation during or after school. For instance, educational institutions could organise some apprenticeship activities and teach how to cultivate and grow vegetables. In addition to this, it often claimed that taking part in these types of activities may develop children's skills and acquiring leadership skills. Moreover, young students could experience different types of cultivation, in order to gain knowledge of agriculture sector. Therefore, these may be useful for children's career prospects and for their future.
Secondly, another vital aspect of our world that should be considered is the wildlife, especially there some animals endangered. In other words, animals have become significant for the world's ecosystems and useful for companionship. For example, it is generally agreed that children may have to learn how to maintain animals. Additionally, children could experience activities in animals protection associations, in order to learn how to keep and protect animals with the support of some volunteers. As a result, children when they grow up are aware to the fact that animals are important and have to be always appreciated and respected.
In conclusion, as far as I'm concerned, the advantages of learning how to cultivate vegetables and keep animals definitely outweigh the drawbacks. Additionally, there is no doubt that children doing these activities may gain many positive experiences, develop their skills and learn how value and appreciate the environment including wildlife.
",
evaluation:
'Criteria 1: Task Achievement - The essay addresses the prompt and presents arguments for both the advantages and disadvantages of primary children learning how to grow vegetables and keep animals. The writer also provides a clear opinion on the topic. Overall, the task achievement is good.

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion - The essay is well-structured with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. The writer uses cohesive devices such as transition words and phrases to connect ideas and maintain coherence. However, there could be better organization within the body paragraphs, with each paragraph focusing on one specific advantage or disadvantage. Overall, the coherence and cohesion are good.

Criteria 3: Lexical Resource - The writer demonstrates a good range of vocabulary and uses appropriate terms related to the topic. There are some minor errors in word choice and usage, but they do not significantly affect the overall understanding of the essay. The writer also uses some academic vocabulary, such as "ecosystems" and "apprenticeship activities." Overall, the lexical resource is good.

Criteria 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy - The essay shows a good range of grammatical structures, including complex sentences and conditionals. There are some errors in subject-verb agreement, verb tense consistency, and pronoun usage. However, these errors do not hinder overall comprehension. With some improvement in grammatical accuracy, the score for this criterion could be higher.

Based on these criteria, the essay would likely receive a band score of 6.5 or 7. The essay effectively addresses the prompt, presents relevant arguments, and demonstrates a good range of vocabulary. However, some errors in grammar and organization slightly affect the overall score.

prompt:
Prompt:
It is suggested that primary children should learn how to grow vegetables and keep animals. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?

Essay: 
It is proposed that elementary schools should teach their pupils vegetable growing and animal keeping skills. Although there are controversial views towards this proposal, I believe that its benefits outweigh its drawback for a range of reasons stated below.
On the one hand, experiences of vegetable growning and animals keeping can help children develop some first hand knowledge and some key characters that would benefit them in the long run. Firstly, by involving in the process of vegetables growing, children gain in-depth understanding of the nature and its impact on the development of a life cycle. In this case, they are capable of learning some practiacal knowledge regarding how weather and seasons could either foster or destruct the growth of plants. Secondly, keeping pets or other animals can encourage the deveopment of the pupils' responsibility. As they learn how to rountinely feed animals, and take showers for them, their responsbility and empathy also grow hand in hand, which would lay a solid foundation for their future study, family life and professional career.
On the other hand, it may be argued that taking such courses could distact students from their intensive study. It is not necessarily true because the aforementioned knwledge and skills can be transferble to their academic study and social life in schools. For example, their first hand experiences of growing vegetables can advance their understanding of some theoretical knowledge about plants in the bilogy class. The empathy deveoped through raising animlas could be also taken advantage to strengthen relationships with teachers and peers.

It is advised that toddlers should learn about growing vegetables and raising animals. Although there are downsides to this proposal, the overall advantages seem to outweigh the disadvantages in this matter.
The main advantage of teaching the younger generation how to farm vegetables and keeping animals is that it can enhance their understanding of the environment. In addition, by learning about foods and animals, children could quickly develop their awareness of not wasting food. Only when children realize how difficult and complicated it is to nurture food, can they stop wasting food or throwing food they dislike. For instance, public schools in Melbourne developed a targeted curriculum to supporting primary children to learn about the growth of foods and the significance of preserving the environment and reduce food waste. Hence, the advantage is obvious since younger pupils must recognise the world they live in.
However, it is suggested that the physical risk of allowing primary offspring to learn about farming could not be overlooked. One of the root disadvantages of caring for animals is the safety issue as animals might have potentially harmful effects on young kids. To elaborate, there is a mixture of the hidden virus on animals' bodies, due to the fragility of children's immune systems, they are too vulnerable to defend against external viruses, not to even mention the physical attack from animals to children. According to the agricultural department, there are 300 cases of animals attacking children reported every year in China, which could be considered as a piece of strong evidence of the disadvantages.
In conclusion, despite the potential drawbacks of learning about animals and floras, the benefits of involving young toddlers in discovering about the environment still outweigh the downside.
